settings.title: Description
settings.content:
Keep your hands dry and comfortable with DRYE gloves – the first gloves that actively wick moisture away from the skin for long-term relief. Developed over seven years in collaboration with Sweden’s top research institutions, these gloves use advanced moisture-wicking technology to help reduce issues like eczema, dermatitis, and Raynaud’s.

Made from sustainable wood cellulose, DRYE gloves create a breathable, hypoallergenic barrier that is gentle on the skin and designed for daily use. Unlike cotton, bamboo, and silk, DRYE gloves offer superior moisture control, making them a better choice for people with skin issues.

Continual use has been shown to reduce the need for costly creams and ointments. Lifespan: 3–12 months.

settings.title: How to use
settings.content:
To get the best results from your DRYE eczema-friendly gloves, follow these simple steps:

1. Start with Clean, Dry Hands: Before wearing your DRYE gloves, ensure your hands are clean and dry. This helps prevent trapped moisture, which could lead to irritation or discomfort. Proper hand hygiene is key to effective skin protection.

2. Wear Under Gloves for Extra Protection: DRYE gloves can be worn under work, sport, or protective gloves for added protection. This extra layer helps shield your skin from dryness and irritants while allowing for comfort and full mobility.

3. Wear Daily for Consistent Relief: For lasting relief from eczema, dry, or cracked skin, wear DRYE gloves daily. Regular use soothes skin, reduces flare-ups, and maintains a protective barrier against environmental triggers. Make them part of your daily routine for the best results.

4. Wash & Reuse for Long-Term Durability: DRYE gloves are machine washable up to 90°C. After washing, air dry to maintain softness and effectiveness. Reuse regularly for continuous support, keeping the gloves fresh, hygienic, and durable

settings.title: Areas of use
settings.content:
DRYE Eczema Gloves are the perfect choice for:

Individuals with Skin Conditions: Alleviate symptoms of eczema, psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, and Raynaud's disease. The moisture-wicking properties help protect against common irritants, creating a dry, comfortable environment for sensitive skin. These gloves provide a superior solution for eczema sufferers, offering better moisture control and skin protection.

Athletes: For those engaging in high-intensity activities, these gloves provide dependable moisture control, reducing friction and maintaining grip. Whether you're a hockey player, cross-country skier, or gym enthusiast, DRYE gloves support optimal performance and comfort, providing a better alternative to nitrile gloves or organic cotton gloves in sports environments.

Industry Workers: Designed to withstand demanding environments, DRYE gloves are compatible with protective gear and can be comfortably worn for extended periods. Ideal for mechanics, construction workers, and those in labor-intensive fields, they keep hands dry and shielded from the rigors of the job, offering greater comfort than other gloves. They provide lasting eczema relief while also being an effective solution for sore hands caused by prolonged exposure to harsh conditions.

settings.title: Shipping
settings.content:
• USA & Canada: 10–12 days
  • UK & Europe: 3–5 days
  • Australia: 5–10 days
  • Sweden: 1–3 days

Pre-orders: 5-6 weeks

We are currently not shipping to Germany.

settings.title: Money-back guarantee
settings.description: If you’re not satisfied, we’ll refund you.

settings.title: Scientifically tested
settings.description: Developed & tested for over 5 years with leading experts.

settings.title: Superior Moisture Control
settings.content: Proven, market-leading moisture-wicking fabric that reduces irritation and supports healing.

settings.title: Breathable and Hypoallergenic
settings.content: Ultra-thin, hypoallergenic design for sensitive skin comfort.

settings.title: Sustainable and Washable
settings.content: Partly biodegradable, lasts 3-12 months, and washable for extended use.

settings.content: Developed over 7 years by leading universities, engineers, and professionals in Sweden.

settings.title: Pre-Launch Announcement
settings.content:
Exciting News! Starting in September, DRYE will be available for the consumer market!

• Join us to discuss hand health

• Share experiences and insights

• Learn more about our gloves and pre-launch details

• Gain access to benefits

• Enjoy behind-the-scenes content and more!

I've had eczema on my hands for a long time, and it's been tough to put on my hockey gloves. These glove liners have improved my experience by reducing friction against my skin. At first, it felt a bit weird, but now I've gotten so used to them that I actually don’t want to play without them anymore. It's just more comfortable with them on.
settings.author: Linnea Petterson Dove

settings.content: I used to have issues with cracked hands and eczema, These gloves have helped a lot. No more itching or sweating, and they fit well.
settings.author: Adam Hemberg

settings.content: Incredibly good gloves for someone with dry skin. Big plus that these can handle industrial washing and still work perfectly afterward.
settings.author: Jens Stålnacke

settings.content: They keep my hands dry and comfortable. It took a little getting used to, but now they’re just part of my routine.
settings.author: Emilia A
settings.prof: Pastry Chef, Robin Delselius Bageri AB

settings.content: They’re comfortable to wear, and my hands feel less dry and irritated now. Definitely an improvement.
settings.author: Sofia Malmberg

settings.content:
Innovative sweat transporting tech

Ensures dry, irritation-free hands during extended wear.

Cost-effective

Even though the initial cost is higher, a washable and reusable option will be a more cost-effective choice over time.

Crafted in Sweden

Proudly made in Sweden, guaranteeing quality materials and manufacturing standards.

Versatility and comfort

Ultra-thin material offers an exclusive feel and is suitable for various activities.

settings.heading: The first layer wicks it away.
The second absorbs and evaporates it.

settings.review_tags: Fit: True to Size|Comfort: Average|Quality: Average

settings.heading: The 4 Biggest Reasons People with Eczema Are Switching to DRYE

settings.text: If cotton, silk, and bamboo gloves haven’t worked for you, here’s why DRYE is different.

settings.description1: Sweat buildup is one of the biggest eczema triggers. DRYE actively moves moisture away from the skin, stopping flare-ups before they start.
settings.title2: Designed to Fit – No More One-Size-Fits-All
settings.description2: Moisturizing gloves are too loose or tight, causing friction and discomfort. DRYE is designed for a proper fit, ensuring smooth, irritation-free wear under any glove.

settings.description1: No more rough, damp, or sticky liners that rub against irritated skin. DRYE’s breathable, hypoallergenic fabric feels soft and smooth while reducing friction that can make eczema worse.
settings.description2: Unlike cotton, silk, or bamboo liners that wear out fast, DRYE lasts 3-12 months while keeping hands dry and comfortable—wash after wash.

settings.text:
If you have hand eczema, you already know—moisture is your worst enemy. The moment sweat gets trapped inside gloves, it creates the perfect storm for irritation, itching, and flare-ups. Traditional liners only absorb the sweat, making the problem worse as they become damp and sticky.

The key to relief? Keeping moisture away from your skin before it can trigger symptoms. That’s exactly what DRYE’s glove liners do. By actively transporting sweat away instead of trapping it, they keep your hands dry, reducing the risk of irritation from the first wear.
